title: APN Convenience Retail REIT seeks to raise $38 million
text:
APN Convenience Retail REIT is seeking to raise $38 million via an institutional placement.

Moelis Australia is offering the shares at a fixed price of $3.39, a 3.7 per cent discount to the last close and a 3.2 per cent discount to the five-day volume weighted average price, according to terms sent to fundies on Friday.

APN Convenience Retail REIT is raising fresh funds to pay for the acquisition of 13 new petrol stations. supplied

Raising proceeds will be used to "partially fund approximately $75 million in proposed acquisitions that consist of 13 service station and convenience retail properties in South Australia, Western Australia, Queensland and Northern Territory," the term sheet said.

The issuer is APN Funds Management which is the responsible entity of APN Convenience Retail REIT.

The trust listed on the ASX in July 2017. It owns 69 service station and convenience retail assets across the eastern seaboard of Australia.
description: APN Convenience Retail REIT is seeking to raise $38 million via an institutional placement.
